column5: My 3 fishing buddies and I have booked a cottage for a week in August at Mashkinonje Lodge located in the north West Arm.Â We have never beenÂ that area and are looking forward to going there to fish for bass, pike &Â walleye.Â Any fishing recommendationsÂ in the West ArmÂ and experiences withÂ the lodge would be much appreciated.Â Thanks.

My wife and I have been going to Mashkinonje a couple times a year for the last 6 or so years. It was just sold andÂ we haven't met the new owners yet but we're heading there in 2 weeks. The cabins are nice and the previous owner put in all new docks and they also have gas there too. I never fished in that area myself but rather boated out to the West BayÂ but I'm sure others can help you with that. You'll enjoy your stay there and the area is beautiful too. The view in the evening

Word has it the waters around the Big Cut are pretty productive. It's a cool ride through the cut, and you can make your way down to Monetville. Last time I was there, someone was perma-squatting in the area, which was a sore point with some people. Wish someone would have taken it down their tents and stuff (Hi CO), cuz it was a really nice campsite/shore lunch spot that was unavailable to others. But agree with Lew re: West Bay. Have had very productive days in some bays, which shall remain unidentified
Do not fish the purple spot without leaders. You will lose every bait you throw. Right Lew ğŸ¤£

Just got back from our week at West Arm. The accommodation was good, the weather was hot and the fishing was very slow. We caught several pike, aÂ bass, a sheep head and no walleye. We released all and had brought enough food with us on the tripÂ to still eat well.Â My buddy had a muskie on but it broke his leader, he was using the wrong type of leader.
we vacationed last week as well, and the place we stayed (Jack Lake...the one near Burk's Falls) the fishing was very slow as well. Maybe weather related?
Good to hear you enjoyed Mashkinonje and got into a few fish as well. We're heading back up next Saturday for another week.
Life is funny Lew...People come our way to vacation and we head up north...
Will be in that cottage for a week starting Saturday 4th. Hope you left it tidy..ğŸ˜
We cleaned up and they clean and check as well. The shower is small but other than that it is an OK cottage.
Yeah we have stayed in that one and other cottagesÂ at Mashkinonje many times. It will be interesting to see how the new owners manage it.

We talked to the new owners several times,Â they do daily cottage visits to look after anyÂ customers concerns and Â plan to do some improvement renovations later this fall. We were treated very well by the owners.
We always stay in cabin 5 and the shower is tiny and when we were up in June they said they were hoping to get a bigger shower installed later this year. Your right, they do seem like good people.
